title: How to Make Homemade Spa Kit for Mum

steps.headline: Get your tube container and fill it with 1 tablespoon of honey.
Pour in 1 cup of milk.
steps.description: It's up to you what type of milk.

steps.headline: Now pour in one quarter of unscented shampoo into the bottle.
steps.description: This helps it make the bubbles.

steps.headline: Add 3 to 4 puffs of any type of hand soap.
Mix everything and then put you bubble bath into the basket.
steps.description: At this stage, you can put a few drops of food coloring.

steps.headline: Get a container to store your body scrub.
Put 4 tablespoons (59.1 ml) sugar or salt.
steps.description: into the container. The sugar or salt helps with exfoliation, which is removing dead skin cells from the surface of your skin.

steps.headline: Put 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of your choice of oils into the container.
steps.description: if you want, at this point, put in 2 drops of food coloring, not too much or it may stain your skin. You can also add flavor extracts for the scent (not edible!)

steps.headline: Mix well and put it in your basket.
Get your tube container.
steps.description: Fill it up halfway with honey.

steps.headline: Fill up the other half with extra virgin olive oil.
Shake it all up and then you are done!
Get your container and fill it up halfway with sugar.
Add 1 teaspoon of olive oil.
Add a few drops of vitamin-E.
Add 1/4 teaspoon of honey.
Mix it and then you are done.
steps.description: Put it in the basket, of course.

steps.headline: In a bowl, mix your gelatin into one cup of hot water.
steps.description: Make sure it dissolves properly. The bowl does not have to be any certain material, but plastic or metal is recommended. If your water is extremely hot and you are afraid of melting the plastic, use a metal bowl. (Of course, hot water melting plastic is not common at all, so don't worry.)

steps.headline: Pour one quarter cup of soap into your bowl.
Add food coloring into the mixture.
Refrigerate for 2 hours and then you are done.
steps.description: Put it into a container and put that in the basket.

steps.headline: Fill up your container halfway with sea salt.
Fill the other half with olive oil.
You may put in vanilla essence, but this is not necessary.
steps.description: Any essences, like rose oil, lavender oil, or something else that smells good will also work.

steps.headline: Put it in your basket.

tyn: Containers for your products. Small tupperware work well, but do not look elegant. Consider buying the containers.
text: Honey and milk bubble bath Get your tube container and fill it with 1 tablespoon of honey.  Pour in 1 cup of milk. It's up to you what type of milk. Now pour in one quarter of unscented shampoo into the bottle. This helps it make the bubbles. Add 3 to 4 puffs of any type of hand soap.  Mix everything and then put you bubble bath into the basket. At this stage, you can put a few drops of food coloring. Body Scrub Get a container to store your body scrub.  Put 4 tablespoons (59.1 ml) sugar or salt. into the container. The sugar or salt helps with exfoliation, which is removing dead skin cells from the surface of your skin. Put 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of your choice of oils into the container. if you want, at this point, put in 2 drops of food coloring, not too much or it may stain your skin. You can also add flavor extracts for the scent (not edible!) Mix well and put it in your basket.  Honey and Oil hair treatment Get your tube container. Fill it up halfway with honey. Fill up the other half with extra virgin olive oil.  Shake it all up and then you are done! Put it in the basket. Lip scrub Get your container and fill it up halfway with sugar.  Add 1 teaspoon of olive oil.  Add a few drops of vitamin-E.  Add 1/4 teaspoon of honey.  Mix it and then you are done. Put it in the basket, of course. Soap Jellies In a bowl, mix your gelatin into one cup of hot water. Make sure it dissolves properly. The bowl does not have to be any certain material, but plastic or metal is recommended. If your water is extremely hot and you are afraid of melting the plastic, use a metal bowl. (Of course, hot water melting plastic is not common at all, so don't worry.) Pour one quarter cup of soap into your bowl. Mix and mix! Add food coloring into the mixture.  Refrigerate for 2 hours and then you are done. Put it into a container and put that in the basket. Salt and oil foot scrub Fill up your container halfway with sea salt.  Fill the other half with olive oil. Mix well! You may put in vanilla essence, but this is not necessary. Any essences, like rose oil, lavender oil, or something else that smells good will also work. Put it in your basket.
sentences: Honey and milk bubble bath Get your tube container and fill it with 1 tablespoon of honey.
Pour in 1 cup of milk.
It's up to you what type of milk.
Now pour in one quarter of unscented shampoo into the bottle.
This helps it make the bubbles.
Add 3 to 4 puffs of any type of hand soap.
Mix everything and then put you bubble bath into the basket.
At this stage, you can put a few drops of food coloring.
Body Scrub Get a container to store your body scrub.
Put 4 tablespoons (59.1 ml) sugar or salt.
into the container.
The sugar or salt helps with exfoliation, which is removing dead skin cells from the surface of your skin.
Put 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of your choice of oils into the container.
if you want, at this point, put in 2 drops of food coloring, not too much or it may stain your skin.
You can also add flavor extracts for the scent (not edible!)
Mix well and put it in your basket.
Honey and Oil hair treatment Get your tube container.
Fill it up halfway with honey.
Fill up the other half with extra virgin olive oil.
Shake it all up and then you are done!
Put it in the basket.
Lip scrub Get your container and fill it up halfway with sugar.
Add 1 teaspoon of olive oil.
Add a few drops of vitamin-E.  Add 1/4 teaspoon of honey.
Mix it and then you are done.
Put it in the basket, of course.
Soap Jellies In a bowl, mix your gelatin into one cup of hot water.
Make sure it dissolves properly.
The bowl does not have to be any certain material, but plastic or metal is recommended.
If your water is extremely hot and you are afraid of melting the plastic, use a metal bowl.
(Of course, hot water melting plastic is not common at all, so don't worry.)
Pour one quarter cup of soap into your bowl.
Mix and mix!
Add food coloring into the mixture.
Refrigerate for 2 hours and then you are done.
Put it into a container and put that in the basket.
Salt and oil foot scrub Fill up your container halfway with sea salt.
Fill the other half with olive oil.
Mix well!
You may put in vanilla essence, but this is not necessary.
Any essences, like rose oil, lavender oil, or something else that smells good will also work.
Put it in your basket.
